plant.family: It belongs to the family Viscaceae1.
plant.description:
Brief Description:
    ◦ Appearance: The American Mistletoe is a perennial parasitic shrub characterized by round, highly branched green stems. It has evergreen, ovoid leaves that grow opposite one another and produces white berries, each containing a single seed1.
    ◦ Habitat: It grows as a parasite on deciduous trees1.
    ◦ Where Commonly Found: While found naturally on trees, it is frequently brought into homes as a decorative plant during the Christmas season12.
